sentence.Network_en: By his own admission, he evaded taxes as a Florida real-estate speculator.
sentence.Network_cn: 他亲口承认自己在佛罗里达从事房地产投机生意时逃过税。

sentence.Network_en: He was a sinister and crafty speculator.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是一个险诈的投机商.

sentence.Network_en: The stake was large, and Harkness was a daring speculator.
sentence.Network_cn: 赌注不小, 而哈克尼斯又是一个大胆的投机家.

entry.def: A speculator is a person who speculates financially.

means.word_mean: 1. someone who makes conjectures without knowing the facts
2. someone who risks losses for the possibility of considerable gains

auth_sentence.content: People say that he is a daring speculator.
auth_sentence.res_content: People say that he is a daring speculator.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: People say that he is a daring speculator.

auth_sentence.content: "I am proud to be a speculator," Niederhoffer wrote.
auth_sentence.res_content: "I am proud to be a speculator," Niederhoffer wrote.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "I am proud to be a speculator," Niederhoffer wrote.

auth_sentence.content: Boesky was a stock speculator who pleaded guilty and served two years in prison.
auth_sentence.res_content: Boesky was a stock speculator who pleaded guilty and served two years in prison.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Boesky was a stock speculator who pleaded guilty and served two years in prison.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 想不到的, 意外的, 未预料到
stems_affixes.word_buile: un不+expect[v.预期;期望,指望]+ed表形容词→adj.想不到的, 意外的, 未预料到
expect[v.预期;期望,指望]+ation表名词→n.预期,期望,指望
speculate投机;思索,推测+ion表名词→n.思索,推测,投机

means.word_mean: 投机倒把者, 投机商

sentences.en: These houses were built by property speculators.
sentences.cn: 这些房屋是由地产投机商建造的。
